articles.author: Paritosh Bansal
articles.description: Treasury market participants expect U.S. regulators to soon finalize a major rule aimed at reining in debt-fueled bets by hedge funds and bolstering financial stability. They worry it could also reshape the industry and create new problems.
articles.title: In the Market: Treasury market braces for seismic SEC rule

articles.author: Giulio Piovaccari, Giselda Vagnoni
articles.description: Around 230 workers in Italy's "Motor Valley" have begun striking over the planned closure of their auto parts factory, an early casualty of the European Union's transition towards electric vehicles.
articles.title: Marelli plant closure forewarns painful electric vehicle transition

articles.author: Amina Niasse
articles.description: U.S. vacation home sales have fallen by nearly three-quarters from their frenzied pace three years ago as an inventory shortage spawns a wrenching correction in the second-homes market.
articles.title: US second home sales slide in pandemic-era vacation hot spots

articles.author: Akash Sriram
articles.description: 3D metal-printing startup Seurat Technologies on Monday hinted at potentially going public in the medium-term and said it had raised $99 million in a funding round co-led by chip designer Nvidia's (NVDA.O) venture capital arm.
articles.title: Nvidia-backed startup Seurat hints at IPO after $99 mln fundraise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian labor union Unifor said early on Monday it has commenced strikes at all Stellantis (STLAM.MI) facilities in the country, with more than 8,200 members staging a walkout after failing to reach a tentative agreement in labor contract talks.
articles.title: Canadian union Unifor begins strikes at all Stellantis facilities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: McDonald's (MCD.N) beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and sales on Monday, powered by new launches as well as steady demand for its cheaper burgers and fries from diners struggling with still-high food prices.
articles.title: McDonald's beats sales estimates as cheaper menu, new launches drive demand

articles.author: Clare Jim, Yu Xie
articles.description: A Hong Kong court gave China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) a five week reprieve to come up deal with creditors or face liquidation after the embattled developer said on Monday it was working on a revised debt restructuring plan.
articles.title: China Evergrande winding-up hearing adjourned as it seeks new debt deal

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians in northern Gaza reported fierce air and artillery strikes early on Monday as Israeli troops backed by tanks pressed into the enclave with a ground assault that drew increased international calls for the protection of civilians.
articles.title: Israel pounds Gaza's north as it steps up ground assault

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Katie Paul, Sheila Dang
articles.description: Maria Julia Cassis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.
articles.title: Graphic pro-Israel ads make their way into children’s video games

articles.author: Yew Lun Tian
articles.description: Chinese and Russian military chiefs targeted the United States for criticism at a security forum in Beijing on Monday, even as China's second-most-senior military commander vowed to boost defence ties with Washington.
articles.title: China and Russia take aim at US at Chinese military forum
